intro: Saussurea schlagintweitii, commonly known as the Afghan gumweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, fibrous stalks and yellowish to brownish flowers. The plant is adapted to arid and high-altitude environments, often growing in rocky soils. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which helps reduce water loss. Saussurea schlagintweitii is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
